musicalLanguage.description: The most-searched piano piece on the internet. Yiruma (Lee Ru-ma) wrote this in 2001 and it became the gateway drug for a generation of piano learners. Built on flowing arpeggios over a I-V-vi-IV progression (the 'pop canon'), its beauty lies in the seamless right-hand melody floating over left-hand waves.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro (sparse) - A (melody with arpeggios) - B (fuller, more intense) - A return (decorated) - Coda
keyMoments: The opening sparse notes: establishes the key and mood with minimal material
The main melody entry: the singable right-hand theme that everyone knows
The B section climax: fuller texture, both hands active, emotional peak
The return: the melody comes back, now decorated and more confident
teachingGoals: Melody projection — making the right-hand melody sing above the accompaniment
I-V-vi-IV progression recognition (the most common progression in pop music)
Tempo rubato — subtle push and pull of timing for expression
styleTips: The left hand is a river — constant, flowing, even
The right hand floats above — slightly louder, singing
Use pedal generously but change on every chord
Small tempo fluctuations are welcome — this isn't a metronome piece
Don't overdo dynamics — the range is pp to mf, never ff
